qas.question: How many colleges compete at the Division 1 level in North Carolina?
Where were the ACC football and basketball championships recently held?
What stadium host the ACC championship game and the Belk Bowl each year?
How many times has North Carolina hosted the NCAA final four?

context: College sports are also popular in North Carolina, with <a0_0>18<a0_0/> schools competing at the Division I level. The Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC) is headquartered in <a1_0>Greensboro<a1_0/>, and both the ACC Football Championship Game (Charlotte) and the ACC Men's Basketball Tournament (Greensboro) were most recently held in <a2_0>North Carolina<a2_0/>. College basketball in particular is very popular, buoyed by the Tobacco Road rivalries between Duke, North Carolina, North Carolina State, and Wake Forest. The ACC Championship Game and The Belk Bowl are held annually in <a3_0>Charlotte's Bank of America Stadium<a3_0/>, featuring teams from the ACC and the Southeastern Conference. Additionally, the state has hosted the NCAA Men's Basketball Final Four on <a4_0>two<a4_0/> occasions, in Greensboro in 1974 and in Charlotte in 1994.
